title: jpcfan
author: jpcfan
content: i figure all crypto gambling streamers will go to youtube. but as you know that won't last long.youtube will do what they do best, censor the biggest channels as soon as they are settled in.Stunna, can you make a site thats just for crypto gambling streaming? you would make millions from it. i love watching slot streamers. its great entertainment.

comments.author: ultrloa
comments.body: Quote from: jpcfan on September 26, 2022, 08:54:17 AMi figure all crypto gambling streamers will go to youtube. but as you know that won't last long.youtube will do what they do best, censor the biggest channels as soon as they are settled in.Stunna, can you make a site thats just for crypto gambling streaming? you would make millions from it. i love watching slot streamers. its great entertainment.Don't limit yourself on things you only see for short term only because if there are platform close door towards other things for sure there are other will rise since people are so innovative towards things they can take advantage with. And provably youtube will be another alternative but in future maybe we can see a streaming platform where it will focus on cryptocurrency industry or web3 rather where many people like streamers can take advantage with.

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: The topic has already been discussed as far as where streamers might go. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5414408.0 Using the search function could have helped you out on the topic.Regarding Drake (I hear he will be live in 2 weeks or so ), he will probably go to dlive with stake if they do purchase the platform.

comments.author: jpcfan
comments.body: BTW, i have never scammed anyone. EVER and ive been here since 2014name 1 person i have scammed.you can't

comments.author: Despairo
comments.body: You're wrong here, Twitch doesn't ban gambling streamer e.g. Drake because he's gambling on sport betting, not luck based games e.g. slots, roulette, dice etc. The problem is Twitch banning the site e.g. Stake, if Stake separate his casino site and sportsbook site, of course they will can advertise on Twitch.Youtube is worst than Twitch, so I don't think there's another good platform for Drake except Twitch since the other platforms doesn't popular.

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: Quote from: Despairo on September 26, 2022, 09:47:30 AMYou're wrong here, Twitch doesn't ban gambling streamer e.g. Drake because he's gambling on sport betting, not luck based games e.g. slots, roulette, dice etc. The problem is Twitch banning the site e.g. Stake, if Stake separate his casino site and sportsbook site, of course they will can advertise on Twitch.What do you mean exactly with this? If Stake, as a separate entity, goes live on Twitch that is okay? Stake is a gambling entity, and it's not safe from Twitch's ban since they are a gambling platform.Quote from: Despairo on September 26, 2022, 09:47:30 AMYoutube is worst than Twitch, so I don't think there's another good platform for Drake except Twitch since the other platforms doesn't popular.For now there aren't any alternatives. Twitch is the best out of there as of now and there's no changing that any time soon. Dlive is a good platform but very few viewers at a time, although I think Drake can pull a lot of viewers since a lot of huge Twitch names in the past managed to pull viewers from Twitch to other live streaming platform (Mixer) in the past with enough hype and advertisement of the switch.

comments.author: jpcfan
comments.body: Quote from: Despairo on September 26, 2022, 09:47:30 AMYoutube is worst than Twitch, so I don't think there's another good platform for Drake except Twitch since the other platforms doesn't popular.i agree youtube is worse. i'm tired of big tech controlling everything we do.we need a legit site that only stream gambling. so people who go there know exactly whats there

comments.author: maydna
comments.body: You can wait for the next announcement because I am sure that they will tell their fan where they will stream. That will not end the show, and even they can become bigger than before. Or perhaps, there are announcements from Twitch related to that banned.But if Stunna can create a new website streaming to accommodate people who want to promote using live online, that will be a good idea because, yes, that will be a big business they can get.

comments.author: dimonstration
comments.body: Is there any official twitch announcement regarding this news? I’m casually watching gambling stream when I have time to watch more after watching my favorite gamer streamer. I doubt having a live platform specific for gambler can compete twitch because twitch is the most preferred streaming site of all viewers unless they can on board popular influencers exclusive on new platform then this might work.Decentralized streaming site like Theta.tv and Streamcoin so that there will be no more restrictions and censorship from the government,

comments.author: Beparanf
comments.body: Quote from: dimonstration on September 26, 2022, 10:45:02 AMIs there any official twitch announcement regarding this news? I’m casually watching gambling stream when I have time to watch more after watching my favorite gamer streamer. I doubt having a live platform specific for gambler can compete twitch because twitch is the most preferred streaming site of all viewers unless they can on board popular influencers exclusive on new platform then this might work.Decentralized streaming site like Theta.tv and Streamcoin so that there will be no more restrictions and censorship from the government,This is already official since twitch already make an official statement. This is just a rumor before since there’s a discussion here about gambling streamer using money of there viewer on his own bet. This is illegal against twitch terms and conditions which intensify the urge on banning all gambling related streams to protect there user for possible loss due to addiction and scam scheme.You can read discussion about this here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5414408.0

comments.author: virasisog
comments.body: Quote from: jpcfan on September 26, 2022, 08:54:17 AMI figure all crypto gambling streamers will go to youtube. but as you know that won't last long.youtube will do what they do best, censor the biggest channels as soon as they are settled in.Stunna, can you make a site that's just for crypto gambling streaming? you would make millions from it. I love watching slot streamers. It's great entertainment.I'm sure that gambling streamers including Drake could still find another opportunity to pursue streaming. The banning of Twitch won't end their journey that easily, especially for many fans and audiences that support them. They will surely be more platforms that would open their doors for gambling streamers. We all know that the innovation of the latest technology is continuous and new platforms are being launched daily. Let's see the possible things that could happen in the coming days.

comments.author: noormcs5
comments.body: Quote from: virasisog on September 26, 2022, 02:28:20 PMQuote from: jpcfan on September 26, 2022, 08:54:17 AMI figure all crypto gambling streamers will go to youtube. but as you know that won't last long.youtube will do what they do best, censor the biggest channels as soon as they are settled in.Stunna, can you make a site that's just for crypto gambling streaming? you would make millions from it. I love watching slot streamers. It's great entertainment.I'm sure that gambling streamers including Drake could still find another opportunity to pursue streaming. The banning of Twitch won't end their journey that easily, especially for many fans and audiences that support them. They will surely be more platforms that would open their doors for gambling streamers. We all know that the innovation of the latest technology is continuous and new platforms are being launched daily. Let's see the possible things that could happen in the coming days. Basically, people follow the streamers and not the sites like Twitch or YouTube. Without the content being loaded on this platform, these platforms are zero. People will follow the popular streamers no matter on which platform they will stream. If youtube and twitch start a campaign against crypto gambling videos and streamers, these people will move to other platforms and the audience will also move with them.

comments.author: Jemzx00
comments.body: Quote from: Beparanf on September 26, 2022, 01:29:38 PMQuote from: dimonstration on September 26, 2022, 10:45:02 AMIs there any official twitch announcement regarding this news? I’m casually watching gambling stream when I have time to watch more after watching my favorite gamer streamer. I doubt having a live platform specific for gambler can compete twitch because twitch is the most preferred streaming site of all viewers unless they can on board popular influencers exclusive on new platform then this might work.This is already official since twitch already make an official statement. This is just a rumor before since there’s a discussion here about gambling streamer using money of there viewer on his own bet. This is illegal against twitch terms and conditions which intensify the urge on banning all gambling related streams to protect there user for possible loss due to addiction and scam scheme.You can read discussion about this here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5414408.0The reason why you are still able to view and watch streams from gamblers is that the banning hasn't happened yet but after October 18, all or most gambling-related streams especially those from the gambling platform list will be removed. I doubt, that twitch's reason is about that rumor but rather they want to avoid any future repercussions in case any illicit activities involve gambling, especially on crypto gambling platforms. Also, they've mentioned something about the licensing issue yet there is a crypto casino listed on their ban list that has a license.

comments.author: BobK71
comments.body: Quote from: Jemzx00 on September 26, 2022, 05:39:11 PMQuote from: Beparanf on September 26, 2022, 01:29:38 PMQuote from: dimonstration on September 26, 2022, 10:45:02 AMIs there any official twitch announcement regarding this news? I’m casually watching gambling stream when I have time to watch more after watching my favorite gamer streamer. I doubt having a live platform specific for gambler can compete twitch because twitch is the most preferred streaming site of all viewers unless they can on board popular influencers exclusive on new platform then this might work.This is already official since twitch already make an official statement. This is just a rumor before since there’s a discussion here about gambling streamer using money of there viewer on his own bet. This is illegal against twitch terms and conditions which intensify the urge on banning all gambling related streams to protect there user for possible loss due to addiction and scam scheme.You can read discussion about this here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5414408.0The reason why you are still able to view and watch streams from gamblers is that the banning hasn't happened yet but after October 18, all or most gambling-related streams especially those from the gambling platform list will be removed. I doubt, that twitch's reason is about that rumor but rather they want to avoid any future repercussions in case any illicit activities involve gambling, especially on crypto gambling platforms. Also, they've mentioned something about the licensing issue yet there is a crypto casino listed on their ban list that has a license.Some of the top streamers have threatened to stop gambling streaming on Twitch if they don't shut down the gambling sites. Then they won't be streaming there. Due to which some other sites including Stake.com, Rollbit.com and Duelbits.com have will be banned.But the agency says it won't ban fantasy sports like sports betting, fantasy football or poker. My question is why Stake.com, Rollbit.com and Duelbits.com will be shut down. Is it just because of the license or is there something else?.

comments.author: Viscore
comments.body: Quote from: maydna on September 26, 2022, 10:26:53 AMYou can wait for the next announcement because I am sure that they will tell their fan where they will stream. That will not end the show, and even they can become bigger than before. Or perhaps, there are announcements from Twitch related to that banned.But if Stunna can create a new website streaming to accommodate people who want to promote using live online, that will be a good idea because, yes, that will be a big business they can get. Maybe that will be the best thing to do for now as Twitch will never end it’s show eventually. As for Drake, we aren’t even sure of his future plans so if ever the banning will continue, I guess another door will open for him as Drake is a very influential figure and that he could start seizing another good opportunities fit for him. I just hope another reputable gambling platform will be opening soon.

comments.author: theskillzdatklls
comments.body: Odysee is the obvious streaming platform for people that want to livestream without getting cancelled in the future. It's based on LBRY blockchain technology and has been developed since 2016.YouTube, Twitch and the rest of the deplatforming Big Tech is total cancer. Other centralized solutions are just as cancerous.

comments.author: Baofeng
comments.body: Ok, the OP is asking for alternatives,I know Dlive could be good, and then based on the feedback by other users:Odysee - https://odysee.com/Theta.tv - https://www.theta.tv/StreamcoinAny one wanted to add any stream sites that they know that possible some Twitch gamblers might move because of the ban?

comments.author: batang_bitcoin
comments.body: There are certain games that Twitch won't be allowing streamers to play while on their platform but, it's not generally gamblers that will be out of Twitch.That's why for streamers, they'll only have to pick another game where they can still stream without compromising and violating Twitch's rules about gambling.As for Drake, he's got the platform and he'll be big wherever he goes, his audience and followers will go to just to watch him.

comments.author: carlfebz2
comments.body: Quote from: crzy on September 26, 2022, 08:29:20 PMDrake will find a way, you just need to follow his social account and get updated.Twitch is protecting their own reputation and we cannot blame them for doing this. I’m pretty sure streamers wont stop from this and they will look for alternatives, they can easily attract viewers since they are already known for streaming.Yes, twitch isnt only the streaming platform where people could really make out those streams,it is really just that Twitch was the most popular and now that they are banning most of crypto gambling streamersthen it would really be just common sense that they would really be finding another place where they could really able to stream out.Speaking specifically with Drake then he wont be that dumb on not to findalternatives but its up to people generally on where they would be flocking in if twitch would be applying this ban.Its not something that should bother them and its true that they could simply tell their followers or supporters into their channel into that new platform.

comments.author: AnotherAlt
comments.body: I chatted with Scufferzzz. He got almost 32K followers on twitch. But, after the announcement of the Gambling Ban, He and his other friends are planning to move to dlive.tv. To be honest, I never heard of Dlive.tv. Not sure how popular it is. But, Streamers have over 20 days in their hands. So, they will ask their viewers to move there and subscribe to their channel. I don't know about all streamers. A few of them will move to Dlive.
